title: Rear Suspension Unit - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle under the frame or engine. Position a block to support the rear wheel.
RSU removal CB7; CG7; CM7; CN7; CS7; CT7, CX7, CE7
Remove the drag link to rear suspension unit fixing. Discard the nut.
Remove the sleeve from the drag links and rear suspension unit to release the drag links.
Reposition the drop link plates and position the drag links clear of the rear suspension unit.
Remove the plastic blanking plug that covers the upper fixing for the rear suspension unit.
Never attempt to disassemble the rear suspension unit or remote reservoir. It contains fluid under pressure and serious injury could result if any part of the system is disturbed.
Remove the upper mounting nut and bolt that attaches the rear suspension unit.
to loosen the frame adjuster for the rear suspension unit.
Manoeuvre the unit downwards through the swinging arm and clear of the motorcycle.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: CE7; CB7; CX7; CS7; CN7; CT7; CM7; CG7

search: Rear Suspension Unit - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Perform the following operations:
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle under the frame or engine. Position a block to support the rear wheel.
Rider's Seat - Removal/Installation
Battery - Terminal Disconnect
Remove the drag link to rear suspension unit fixing. Discard the nut.
Remove the sleeve from the drag links and rear suspension unit to release the drag links.
Reposition the drop link plates and position the drag links clear of the rear suspension unit.
Drag links
Drop links
Fixings
Rear suspension unit
Remove the plastic blanking plug that covers the upper fixing for the rear suspension unit.
Blanking plug
Rear suspension unit top fixing
Never attempt to disassemble the rear suspension unit or remote reservoir. It contains fluid under pressure and serious injury could result if any part of the system is disturbed.
Remove the upper mounting nut and bolt that attaches the rear suspension unit.
Use
service tool T3880104
to loosen the frame adjuster for the rear suspension unit.
Manoeuvre the unit downwards through the swinging arm and clear of the motorcycle.
